intro: Saccolabium formosanum, commonly known as the Taiwan false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
